description: Survey course tracing the origins and evolution of the great traditions of U.S. foreign policy, including Exceptionalism, Unilateralism, Manifest Destiny, Wilsonianism, etc., by which Americans have tried to define their place in the world. Three hours of lecture per week, extensive reading, no recitations.
name: AM DIPLO HIST SINCE 1776

values.comments: The reviews for this class were overwhelmingly positive.  Many students wrote that it was the best class that had ever taken, noting that he was the “most animated and engaging professor,” “probably the best teacher,” and “truly genius.” Overall Professor McDougall is adored by his students.
